qas.question: How many years does a student spend in secondary and high school in Swaziland?
For how many years is a Swazi student in junior secondary school?
What is the ECOS within the Swazi education system?
What do students finishing senior secondary school get?

answers.text: Swaziland General Certificate of Secondary Education

qas.question: What institution does the accreditation for the IGCSE in Swaziland?
What education system is divided into 3 years?
What is the name of the private axamination taken at the end of junior secondary?
Who determines if students can go to senior secondary?

plausible_answers.text: the Swaziland General Certificate of Secondary Education

qas.question: What private examination do students sit for at the end of senior secondary?

context: <b5_0>The secondary and high school<b5_0/> education system in Swaziland is a <a0_0>five<a0_0/>-year programme divided into <a1_0>three<a1_0/> years junior secondary and two years senior secondary. There is an external public examination (<b6_0>Junior Certificate<b6_0/>) at the end of the junior secondary that learners have to pass to progress to the senior secondary level. <b7_0>The <a2_0>Examination Council of Swaziland<b7_0/><a2_0/> (ECOS) administers this examination. At the end of the senior secondary level, learners sit for a public examination, <b8_0>the <a3_0>Swaziland General Certificate of Secondary Education<b8_0/><a3_0/> (SGCSE) and International General Certificate of Secondary Education (IGCSE) which is accredited by the <a4_0>Cambridge International Examination<a4_0/> (CIE). A few schools offer the Advanced Studies (AS) programme in their curriculum.
